bibl.title: Alexandria as Place: Tempo-Spatial Traits of Royal Ideology in Early Ptolemaic Egypt.

series.title: Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA.

bibl.note: 1. Place, Space and Identity. - 2. The Founding: from Egypt as Place to Alexandria as Space. - 3. Alexandria as Ptolemaic Place. - 4. Cult and Place in the Early Ptolemaic Period. - 5. Alexandria's Pantheon and the Ptolemies. - 6. Ruler Cult. - 7. Conclusions.

bibl.title: Alexandria. A Cultural and Religious Melting Pot

bibl.seg: KRASILNIKOFF Jens A., Alexandria as Place: Tempo-Spatial Traits of Royal Ideology in Early Ptolemaic Egypt.
George HINGE and Jens A. KRASILNIKOFF (Edd.), Alexandria. A Cultural and Religious Melting Pot = Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA. 9 (Aarhus, 2009) pp. 21-41.

1. Place, Space and Identity. - 2. The Founding: from Egypt as Place to Alexandria as Space. - 3. Alexandria as Ptolemaic Place. - 4. Cult and Place in the Early Ptolemaic Period. - 5. Alexandria's Pantheon and the Ptolemies. - 6. Ruler Cult. - 7. Conclusions.
